intro: Sidopsis hispida, commonly known as the roughleaf dandelion, is a flowering plant native to South America. It is characterized by its hairy, rough-textured leaves and yellow composite flowers. The plant typically grows in open, sunny areas such as grasslands and disturbed soils. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes many familiar flowering plants. Sidopsis hispida is often found in temperate regions and is adapted to thrive in various soil types.
